website_summaries.verdict: A durable, affordable "starter" mini trampoline. The best deal for the lowest price.
pros: A generous 38 inches of surface area
Great for recreational bouncing, especially for users under 220 pounds
cons: Some incidents of spring failure and mat damage

customer_reviews.title: Broken Springs!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this trampoline for four months, and five springs have already broken! I use it four times a week. I weigh about 130 lbs. Other trampolines I have used have lasted MUCH longer. I would not waste money on this trampoline. I am now buying one without metal springs.
customer_reviews.author: FabMom26

customer_reviews.title: Carcinogenic
customer_reviews.text: See the picture attached. I called the company and they verified that the skirt of this trampoline is made of PVC+EPE, materials officially linked to cancer. Do not let kids near it. It stinks too and collects mold under the skirt.
customer_reviews.author: Karine K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble but quick to fall apart
customer_reviews.text: This product is not well built. The springs began to fall off rather quickly. Once one breaks than they all seem to go. It was used primarily by a 145 pound person running in place. The other person using it was 130 pounds. It does not live up to what the company claims
customer_reviews.author: EvanBB

customer_reviews.title: its perfect for a rainy day too!
customer_reviews.text: Ohhh its awesome for little ones and big ones too! My 2 year old, myself (154 pounds, and my husband 180 pounds) use it and its wonderful! we get exercise and it holds our weight one at a time. It's great for indoors or out but we use it indoors for rainy days and for times when I'm too busy to get to the bottom of the yard for the big trampoline out there.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Rancatore

customer_reviews.title: Breaks immediately, do not purchase this item
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this a handful of times. I weigh 144lbs and 5 springs have broken already. Very shoddy. Return window has closed so im stuck with this. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Amber Leigh

customer_reviews.title: OMG I LOVE THIS....
customer_reviews.text: Super stable, and super easy to put together. I absolutely LOVE it!!! Easy to use and easy to store on it's side against a wall or under the bed. I roll it around with ease to wherever I wish to use it. It's made of excellent quality also! That's easy to see. Great item and excellent transaction! Thanks kindly!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: It's great to be able to do some fun cardio exercise indoors !
customer_reviews.text: I don't jump (feet leaving the surface) so much as just bounce on this. I either lean leg to leg, or do both at once. You can adjust your workout by how vigorously you choose to move. Great for "dancing" to get some exercise. I don't have balance problems, but if one did, I bet just putting a sturdy chair next to this would help. Very quiet, too. I am on the second floor of an apartment building and the person in the apartment below me doesn't hear me exercise at all.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Berdon

customer_reviews.title: It will not last a month and customer service does not answer the phone.
customer_reviews.text: Springs broke exactly after a month and one day. I bought a cheap model to try out but I never thought it would last only a month. I was expecting to upgrade in 6 month but guess what? I will have to buy another one right now. Trampolines are very cool in fact, but do not buy the Pure Fun brand if you want something that will last at least more than a month. Awful product. Hard to reach customer service and not even their site is up.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia A. Da Silva

customer_reviews.title: Fun mini-trampoline
customer_reviews.text: I have used it a few times and just wish I had more time to use it! It is a great, sturdy device to jump on and was super easy to assemble. I just need to make more time to use it because lately the weather is so inclement I can't get outside to walk or exercise. But when I do have time to do a little exercise in my home this is perfect. It fits in our double door bedroom closet or underneath the bed in the master bedroom fine, but is too big to stow away in the hall closet.
customer_reviews.author: Suzupergrrrl

customer_reviews.title: Great ! Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for the kind of mini tramp that has screw on legs...not easy to find anymore ....This is exactly what I was looking for and have previously used in the past....works great . I use for indoor jogging....
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy1904

customer_reviews.title: WOW IT ACTUALLY WORKS
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to CLEAR flemn and mucus from my air ways. I set it out, jump up and down 21 times, stack it back out of the way. After 15 minutes my air ways are clear. (Someone told me about this, I didn't believe him but ... well TRY IT! It's a cheap way to breath.) VERY VERY VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent so far
customer_reviews.text: I know that this says for ages 13+ but I actually bought it for my 8 year old. I wanted something super durable because he's rough on things. I also have a 13 yr old and wanted her to be able to use it too.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I appreciated how easy it was to assemble (just screw in the legs). I didn’t appreciate that part of the seam attaching the material to the frame was ripped apart. I’ve only had it for a week. Not sure if I’ll be able to return it. Update: I’ve had this trampoline for 2 1/2 months and two metal springs have completely snapped off, making the thing unusable! I’m extremely disappointed. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ajgood418

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend!! Luckily amazon refunded me the total amount ...
customer_reviews.text: I have ben using this product for 60 days. Thus far 4 springs have broken and it is know dangerous to use. I am 190 lbs and it is rated for 220. It is literally falling apart. Would not recommend!! Luckily amazon refunded me the total amount as it started breaking after about 30 days and I reported it at 60 days. This was with only 30 minutes use a day!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids on the spectrum
customer_reviews.text: This gets daily use in our house and so far is standing up to our three kids (ages 6-10) just fine. I believe we've had it for about 4 months. Recommended! Update 4/14 - Still no problems with this trampoline in our house. All three kids are on it pretty much daily. In fact, we are going to the grandparents' house for Easter and are going to have one shipped to their house. My 10 year old has severe autism and will need something for his sensory input while we are there visiting for a few days. We think this will do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Mom2Three

customer_reviews.title: Love it. It was a great price
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It was a great price. I use it several times a week.I do jumping jacks with weights or other running type exercises. I need to look up more jumping exercises. Gets me sweating and heart rate up.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: love the trampoline - it's big which is what I ...
customer_reviews.text: love the trampoline - it's big which is what I wanted great for bouncing onto a mat or crash pad.. it's tricky to assemble.. took me hours as the directions are not easy to follow, especially when assembling the bar - which I ended up scrapping. but great to work out on and for the kids to play
customer_reviews.author: paristexas

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Interesting that this product is no longer available, it should not be for sale on Amazon. Three coils broke in the 6th month rendering it unusable and the only person who used it was my 130 lb 14 year old. Incredibly poor quality, I wish I could get a refund. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ringewald

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to exercise
customer_reviews.text: I love this mini trampoline. I use it for rebounding, jumping jacks and jogging. Seems very sturdy and have not had any problems with the springs.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great rebounder for the price. I have one at home that is a different brand but a similar price point. I bought this one for the office to support a Motion Program that we have through our health care provider. This product is way better quality than the one I have at home. Much springier making it easier on the joints. I'm really pleased with it. Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: nickinindy

customer_reviews.title: several springs already broken.  useless
customer_reviews.text: terrible. daughter uses. age 15. 5'3". 125 pounds uses daily. several springs already broken. useless now. too much trouble to return. only good for maybe little kids.
customer_reviews.author: The Greg

customer_reviews.title: Worst ever quality, It broke within 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: My previous trampoline last for 10 years but this broken down in very short time. Money wasted on this product. My weight is 145 pounds only, its very much less than promise by the manufacture of the trampoline. I am just using it for 10 mins a day. It broken down when I was jumping , I got little jerky on my one of the legs. metal springs under it broke. Very cheap quality. THIS PRODUCT IS VERY DANGEROUS VERY UNSATISFIED. PLEASE DO NOT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to keep our kids active indoors during the corona pandemic. I wanted something we could use too for excercise. This has been inside, outside, kids, dogs, adults and it is still holding up. For the price I couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: hweekes561

customer_reviews.title: PURE FUN!
customer_reviews.text: great product- fast ship--- great packaging ( i used it to help hold up my leaf bags- acted as a funnel for putting leaves in bag---yes!- and we have A LOT of them in MI.) I had first purchased a tramp that attached to outer rim with bands--oh my what a JARRING experience that was. I returned that one and purchased this one. It is PURE FUN to jump on it--a smooth experience. Great for working out---and grand kids have fun on it too. VERY easy to assemble---just add legs. springs are covered by blue ridge---have had no problems with springs breaking. I believe that they changed the springs design now so that is not a problem anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne E. Groenendyk

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this mini trampoline. Bought it in Dec 2016 and by July 2017 the springs started breaking. I finally had to quit using it because I felt it was dangerous to use, so many springs had broken. I feel it should have lasted longer
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Spring broke after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I'll begin by stating that I really like this trampoline. I use it daily for 30 minutes. Today, while I was jumping, a spring snapped and went airborne. When I looked closer, the metal where the spring is connected is very thin. So much so that I'm surprised I got 8 months out of this.
customer_reviews.author: JSN

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy, and looks great.
customer_reviews.text: First trampoline arrived with bent rim. Replacement was terrible quick! My boy loves this device! It is sturdy, and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Melekhov

customer_reviews.title: Defective Springs
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with the product until the springs began breaking after a few weeks of use. I asked the company to send a complete set of replacement springs as the springs were clearly defective. They sent 5 new springs. After a few days all the replacement springs have been used up and I anticipate the springs to continue to break a the current rate of 1 a day. This product is no bargain.
customer_reviews.author: David M Genadek

customer_reviews.title: good... for a while..
customer_reviews.text: It was a decent trampoline, but I wish it had had the legs that fold down so you can store is flat again a wall with minimal space usage. Also, after a couple months of jumping... the springs started to break! First one.... and then I kept using it, so another.. I tried to find replacement springs, but I don't think they exist. (I'm average weight, and average height - 5'4") Had to put out in the garbage. I feel a little bad about the waste of an otherwise handy device.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMe

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I bought this for my grandkids and they love it. I've not had any problems with it yet!
customer_reviews.author: Carolinedaoud

customer_reviews.title: Great Rebounder & Affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty hesitant about spending upwards of $300 on a Bellicon Rebounder, so I decided that I would try out this one first, to see if I even like rebounding. I picked 2 day prime shipping and it came the next day! It was a total breeze to put together, you just take the caps off the legs, and then screw them onto the body of the rebounder. Less than 5 minutes. It seems very sturdy and I have enjoyed using it! I have problems with my knees, so the low impact is so helpful for me. There are so many benefits to rebounding, I am definitely a believer!
customer_reviews.author: Elle Michelle

customer_reviews.title: but it came in one piece and is wonderful! It is also easy to move around and ...
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this would be flimsy or that I would have to assemble it, but it came in one piece and is wonderful! It is also easy to move around and to store on its side. Great for stress release!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they pop like pretzels with minimal force
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two of these rebounders, the second was to use as replacement springs,they pop like pretzels with minimal force,save your money and do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: charleypotatoes

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. I’ve had it for over a month and no issues so far. It’s sturdy and just as described.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra

customer_reviews.title: otherwise it is a fine machine. The manufacturer did send me additional springs ...
customer_reviews.text: The problem is spring breakage. The springs do not seem to hold up well under constant usage, otherwise it is a fine machine. The manufacturer did send me additional springs at no cost when I notified them of the issue. Amazon was also super quick to replace the product at no charge. Very satisfied with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Gerlach

customer_reviews.title: Finally Found a Metal Spring Trampoline
customer_reviews.text: I've been exercising on this for about 4 months. I had a nordictrack trampoline previous to this one and liked it a lot. The Pure Fun is similar but a softer bounce. I feel lucky to have found this trampoline since I could not find a trampoline with metal springs in any of my local stores. I liked the fact that it was not a big assembly job. Just screw on the legs - done. Good Trampoline - reasonable price. Overall I have been satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jdiane

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy lymph mover
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help get lymph movin especially with it being winter. Like that it has metal springs and it has held up really well. Although I don't go crazy jumping hard on it, I do use it twice a day. If you have kids you might want to put that into consideration. Very happy with purchasing this so far.
customer_reviews.author: carey G

customer_reviews.title: like the product design and manufacturing seems quite solid
customer_reviews.text: like the product design and manufacturing seems quite solid, but unfortunately had a flawed leg - had to exchange since leg was not threaded and could not be screwed on base. Mistake on Amazon website says that the weight limit on the 40 inch units is only 220 lb, vs 250 lb for this one = in fact the manufacturer website quotes both at 250lb... I'm 220 lb and did not want to take any chance. So i returned and exchanged for a 40 inch version which my friend had recommended in the first place!
customer_reviews.author: ALG

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my granddaughter 10 year birthday. She loves it. It's sturdy enough that adults can use it too.
customer_reviews.author: Debi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy trampoline for home exercise
customer_reviews.text: This is my second of these trampolines. The first lasted almost 6 years of very regular use by both me (for home exercise) and my kids (for fun). The first one had started peeling and fraying around the blue part and had lost one spring. It was such a good trampoline though that I made sure to order the exact same one when I replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE. Don't waste your money. The springs break quick.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this trampoline for a little over a month and already 2 springs have broken off. Bought this for my kids one is 65lbs and the other is 80lbs. They use it one at a time and still the springs are breaking off as its being jumped on. They use it for 5-10 minutes at a time and only really when its raining outside and they can't go out and play. DO NOT BUY IT'S NOT WORTH IT. What a waste of money I will not EVER purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Yassin

customer_reviews.title: so great
customer_reviews.text: Love this one too much. It's bigger than I expected, easy to assemble, and very strong. highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 3 year old with the option of us being able to jump on it too. Our daughter loves it. Seems to be fairly solid built. It is super easy to put together. Literally pull the thing out of the package and twist each of the legs on. That's it. My only complaint is that the legs do loosen after lots of jumping. We tighten them once in a while. In the instructions it says not to tighten too tight. Anyway, we are really happy with the tramp. We really like the size...can't imagine it much smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little exercise treasure
customer_reviews.text: Great Trampoline, easy to install only had it 2 weeks and use it each am and pm. great to get fluids pumping in the legs and no stress on knees, feet. Put together very easily. easy to move under bed.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Good ole tire them out fun
customer_reviews.text: My son is 5 he loves it I live on 2nd floor its practically silent
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for more then a month now and as a 220 pound man, I have not noticed any negative concerns at all. It came very promptly and packaged very well. Assembly was very easy. Big advantage with this product having the trampoline already assembled and it's just matter of screwing the legs in. I was very concerned about the competitor trampolines that you still need to attach either springs or bands that can be very dangerous. Using this product for 30 minutes 5 days per week I have already lost 9 pounds. Definitely worth the price and would recommend to any of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Flattail1

customer_reviews.title: Broke apart after 5 months of use
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble but after 5 months of a 110 llb female using it 3-4x a week (and sometimes not using it for a few weeks at all due to the fact we have other exercise equipment) all the hooks broke on the side came off one by one while I was using it in the last month. Definitely not safe because it made me twist my ankle and now we have to throw it out. Next time I’m spending $300 plus and getting one that is really durable.
customer_reviews.author: Shopr

customer_reviews.title: Maybe OK for a child. Lasted 6 months of moderate use for an adult.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, and you DON'T get what you don't pay for. That about sums this one up. At first, it felt like it was going to hold up. It was relatively quiet, and had a firm bounce. Within 3 or so months, the first spring went....after that, it was a systematic failure of springs, sometimes 2 at a time. I am well within the weight limits, and used it about 45 minutes 3 or 4 days a week, only lightly bouncing. If this is for a child, perhaps this product would be appropriate (hence 2 stars), but otherwise I'd skip it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cincotta

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: teenage daughter has used this every day for the last 3 months. It is holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: pie

customer_reviews.title: Didnt last long
customer_reviews.text: Great size and lightweight. Unfortunately. the springs are not holding up. We've had this trampoline for a month and 3 springs have broken. My 9 yr old son (87lbs) uses this daily and is very disappointed it is already breaking. 😕
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Great at a standing desk
customer_reviews.text: I use this at my standing desk and love it! I use it during the week to work and my 6 year old uses it on the weekend to bounce on. It's a win-win!
customer_reviews.author: carolinaagain

customer_reviews.title: Bouncing into shape
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get a mini-tramp to use with my Walk It Out Wii game, but I'm cheap so I didn't want to spend alot of money if it turned out I didn't like it or use it. So far it has been fine. My 12yr old son loves to jump on it as well. For the money spent, I think it is a good trampoline. Easy to put together, just screw on the legs and you are ready to go. It's also easy to move as it doesn't weigh alot. My only complaint would be that it looked like it had been used and returned as the feet were a little scuffed, but nothing major.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly K. Warembourg

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for Nephew!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a gift for my nephew's 12th birthday. He is really into xBox games (which I got him), but I also wanted to get him something that would encourage activity and still be fun. I took a chance on the Mini Trampoline, not entirely sure he would enjoy it. As it turns out, he loves it. He brags to his friends that he has a "room size trampoline" of his own. He uses it daily and has started adding in other "exercises", building himself a fun "workout routine" without even realizing it. I am very happy with the results. So far, the quality of this particular brand is holding up.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor energy bursts
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our son with ASD. He loves to just use it to let off steam or to get out a burst of energy. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Christina H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the whole family, meets everyone's needs.
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. I can use it to work out and it's a great way for the kids to get their ya-ya's out, exercise and meet their sensory needs. If you are looking for an indoor way to help your child on the spectrum, with sensory needs, or y'all are cooped up due to weather or illness, this is perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bastress

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It's been 20 years since I purchased the one this replaced. I had forgotten that springs could be virtually silent. Good for listening to music as I jog. Four stars instead of five because it came with only 5 of the required 6 screw on legs. I had to pirate one from my old model.
customer_reviews.author: Merrill Clark

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy with this trampoline. I bought this for my son to replace one he had before which had become rusted and broken. This trampoline is so hard it's like jumping on a welcome mat. Also, the legs are very slippery so that unless you prop it against something its slips and slides. There was nothing "fun" about it. It's only redeeming quality is that it has a 250 pound weight limit, as opposed to others of this size which usually have a 200 pound weight limit
customer_reviews.author: Luis A. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This is amazingly good for you, in the health and weight loss department. :-) A rebounder or mini trampoline like this is highly recommended by Dee McCaffrey, author of the Science of Skinny. It has made a wonderful difference in health. This is my second one purchased in ten months. I keep it outside on my covered porched, but since I live on the gulf of mexico it doesn't surprise me that after 10 months I needed to replace it. It's priced right!! I'm 55 and weigh 153.
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Allison

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about 3 months, then a spring broke. It really should be more sturdy then that, or at the very least, make it easy and affordable to replace the springs. If you're going to jump on a rebounder regularly, invest in something much better then this!
customer_reviews.author: Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good trampoline
customer_reviews.text: Our 3yo with autism and lots of proprioceptive sensory seeking behavior really *needs* to jump on this. And he loves it! He'll jump on it for an hour at a time. Other typically developing kids seem to love it too. Our nt 1yo bounces on it on her butt and has a blast! I don't think a handle/bar would really be a good addition, I think my kids would just bump their heads on it. As it is, they have learned to jump in the middle and not fall (sometimes we have some slips but nothing bad). Best toy purchase for the money I've made in awhile!
customer_reviews.author: RaeLehman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy......
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mini trampoline for myself. I used to have one years ago and now I am working out again. This is a great tool for low impact exercising, however this product has failed after only 8 uses. The weight limit is 220, and I am 205. I am using indoors. This product should not have broken in such a short period of time. I am hoping the manufacture replaces it for me, although I am thinking it will happen again. I am very disappointment because I thought I was buying higher quality then what I might find in a cheap sporting good store. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Ovilla Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Seems very sturdy and tight bounce
customer_reviews.text: Seems very sturdy and tight bounce. Bought for my 10 year old daughter but the whole family has enjoyed it. Still new so haven't had a chance to see how it holds up after use but I think we will definitely get our $ worth out of it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price :)
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Pure Fun trampoline. It is great for the price. What I found in my research is that all trampolines wear out. Springs will eventually snap. I find that after a year of daily use (or 4-day-a-week use) you'll need a replacement. I save my old trampoline so when springs start to pop on this on I'll be able to replace them and hopefully it will last longer. For the price it is a great vaule.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole L. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Love it - Great Buy, Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I thought based on some negative reviews this was going to be a flimsy shadow of a rebounder, but I thought I'd try it for the money and go in for a better one if I liked it. It's perfect. Very easy assembly (none essentially), nice and sturdy, not noisy, very taut and bouncy, nothing not to like here. At this price, if springs do break, I'd just buy replacements. This is my first experience with rebounding, but really, unless you are a professional rebounder, what could the more expensive ones possible offer that this doesn't? I'm thinking of getting another just like it for a gift. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: rebounding for health
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in one piece! Just had to take off safety caps and screw on legs and bounce! It has been perfect! Bought this to enhance lymphatic health. Found out how to bounce properly via YouTube videos. Great price for what I want. Just started using this trampoline, so not sure if it will last, but I am not doing anything strenuous, so hopefully it will be last a while. Love that I can just step on and start bouncing any time of the day - you can watch the TV and bounce!!
customer_reviews.author: wd

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise/fun Trampoline
customer_reviews.text: Product is great and exactly as described. I bought this for my 10 yr old little girl and she uses it on a regular basis. The top and mat of the trampoline are very well put together and sturdy. The legs just screw on and can become loose after use. Ensure that you tighten them before use and this trampoline should last quite a long time. Trampoline will easily hold my weight (close to 200 lbs) as I have used it more that a few times. Great product for the price and I would recommend this product to anyone for a little fun or just a quick way to get your pulse moving.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger C. Little III

customer_reviews.title: Nice little trampoline, does the job
customer_reviews.text: I read quite a few reviews of this product stating springs broke. So far none have broken for me. I use the trampoline 3-4 times/week for anywhere between 15-30 minutes, nice spring. I definitely would recommend buying the 40 inch, anything smaller doesn't leave much space for being creative when jumping. 40 inches is borderline to small for me, but it's great for extra winter exercise. So far I would certainly recommend it, but I'll give it some more time and exercise to see how well it wears.
customer_reviews.author: pkwitt

customer_reviews.title: My family and I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son to burn some energy while he watches movies or plays video games. Now this is all he does when he gets tv/video game time!! I also use it for excercise. Very quiet too.
customer_reviews.author: ACox

customer_reviews.title: Springs break, customer service is non-existent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my two under-12 boys. They use it daily but moderately, on a wood floor on the upper story of a two-story house, which is relevant because the floor absorbs a great deal of energy. Nonetheless, five springs have snapped thus far and of course as more springs break, those that haven't handle a larger load and will continue to break. I have emailed numerous times asking how to get replacement springs. My emails have never been responded to. I then called several times. My calls roll directly to voicemail. I have gotten no response to several voicemails. Don't bother. We will be returning this soon.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pann

customer_reviews.title: Each time I thought it would be better, last a little longer
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this!! I have bought three from this vendor, and after a few uses the springs start breaking. Each time I thought it would be better, last a little longer! Can't believe I even bought two more after the first one started popping springs right away. I use this in my home gym for cross training, like 5-10 minutes at a time. I am the only one who uses this trampoline, and I weigh 120 lbs. This one, third one, is my last. I contacted the seller, and they never even responded! It is definitely an inferior product,and they do not care.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Good for occasional exercise, but not kids with autism
customer_reviews.text: Great trampoline for basic exercise. It came together - without the legs attached of course. However one spring was missing. My boys have autism and jump constantly so the springs began breaking under heavy use. While great for an occasional use, I can't recommend for kiddos with autism. I would recommend one without springs, one with straps instead
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great trampoline!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a holiday gift for my kids (9 & 12), 4 months later we are still very happy with it. I'm surprised by some of the poor reviews, our experience has been 100% positive. Easy out of the box experience and all of us have enjoyed taking turns jumping. During the winter months we all go a bit stir crazy, so its been a perfect way to get a quick way to release some energy indoors!
customer_reviews.author: gnikw

customer_reviews.title: PURE FUN FUN FUN
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 5 year old grandson, who has a 13 year old sister. Made this purchase so they could both use it. Purchased a month ago, he hasn't stopped bouncing, even using it with his Wii & Wii U, jumping the whole time. It is used by big sister and even mom, for exercise. My 3 year old granddaughter loves it, but she isn't heavy enough to get a good bounce. It isn't meant to be left outside in the weather, but can still be used outdoors. A great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: N. S.

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Easy, Well Built
customer_reviews.text: So fun to workout on this. Simple to assemble, light weight to move around, well built and sturdy. Good choice!
customer_reviews.author: Harmonybme

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 yr old boy with sensory processing disorder. After a full day of school he's just about to fall apart if not for the trampoline! We've had it for a year now and although it was outside for most of the summer it's still in great condition. It was also easy to take apart to clean when it was time to bring it back inside. The only not so great part was that some water sipped between the plastic and sponge(?) lining... But that's my fault for letting it outside during rainy days! I would definitely recommend it for a child!
customer_reviews.author: Walaci Toledo

customer_reviews.title: Its Pure Fun
customer_reviews.text: It really is...I found some youtubes with rebounder exercise ideas...it's just really easy to hop on and get 10-15 minutes in, whenever. It's very compact too, so easy to stash between workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great... while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: When I got this trampoline 1 day after my birthday (Feb. 18) I set it up immediately. It was this exact trampoline (from order dates). I jumped on it every day for a couple of months... then stopped. Then after I got my new iPod I was jumping a lot more often. Then I heard a snap while jumping sometime in August. But it ws just 1 coil so I kept jumping. Then another one broke 2 days later. Then another. And just recently today the whole thing just fell apart. It was great I must admit, but had a short life.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. This is not made well. My first spring broke after using for about 3 months. The second spring broke a month and a half after I replaced the broken spring. You can buy replacement springs but it’s not easy to put on by yourself plus there is the cost since it seems like they break often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kids to get some energy out during the summertime when its really to hot to be outside. Great quality and the kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: Frydawg

customer_reviews.title: 40 Inch tampoline
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandchildren, ages 4 and 6. They love it. It is sturdy, well constructed, and I appreciate how the springs are very well covered with what looks like a sturdy vinyl.Overall it looks like it will last a long time even with a lot of use. Time will tell, however. I plan to order a second one for my other set of grandchildren for the holidays, I like it that much.
customer_reviews.author: Paula J. Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Entire quality of item is poor
customer_reviews.text: Mv son enjoys bouncing on the trampoline & he weighs 115 lbs. Since we received the trampoline, I have changed every spring at least once within 6 months. Poor quality of springs. Constantly breaking!! Very disappointed in the product & to boot, no satisfaction when I contacted the company.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Fun little trampoline - would be good even for kids
customer_reviews.author: SABINE

customer_reviews.title: Who says that exercising can't be fun?
customer_reviews.text: Living in a state that can't make up it's mind about what kind of weather it is going to be outside from one day to the next, I am lucky to have this in my artillery of exercise equipment. I use it to run or bounce in place. I have fun with it and lose weight all at the same time. My little one loves to jump on it too, so it can wear her out and help me lose weight when the weather is crappy outside.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: After 30 days of use by my ninety pound daughter ...
customer_reviews.text: After 30 days of use by my ninety pound daughter, the blue cover over the springs fell apart, and one spring broke. Save yourself the trouble of having these items replaced by the company and find a higher quality item to buy. If I was still within the 30 day return period, I would have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great Trampoline
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic trampoline. It's much better than the folding ones with the bungee straps! This is made the old fashioned way. Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: Had this a few months for my daughter. She doesn't weigh much and had to throw away the trampoline. She hadn't hit 100lbs yet and this trampoline skirt tore off and the springs started to bust. So I bought springs to replace but those started to bust as well. Moral of the story, switched to the mini trampoline with a sort of bungee cord. Works great, no tears.
customer_reviews.author: Warrior Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not enough spring in the bounce
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with this trampoline. There isn't enough spring in the bounce. We mainly ordered this for our small children to jump on but they lost interest pretty quick. I wouldn't recommend it for anyone over 180 pounds, my husband can barely get it to bounce him back up and stated it felt like the springs were going to snap so he quit using it. They certainly do not make these like they used to 20 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: LSNB

customer_reviews.title: Worked for almost a year
customer_reviews.text: My daughter weighs just over 100 lbs and uses the trampoline almost every day for basic bouncing while listening to music. Springs started breaking months after purchase...now unusable (not safe) and springs impossible to find for replacement. Hate to just replace whole thing but going to have to and then purchase better quality trampoline...disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: BGFallbrook

customer_reviews.title: Nice customer service
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson for Christmas. Unfortunately, one leg wouldn't screw in. He was very disappointed to not have it work right away. When my daughter called for a replacement, customer service was very busy, but when she got through, the rep was very nice and the leg arrived promptly. So far it is working great and they are happily bouncing away. It looks like a good product that needs better Q&A before shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Meditator

customer_reviews.title: Heads up!
customer_reviews.text: Mah... Purchased this on 8/15 and by 9/22 a spring broke. My son needs a tramp for sensory reasons. I have purchased many brands and they ALL break with in a short time. Saying that though amazon has been super great in replacing them. 2x same brand. That's the only reason why I have it two stars.
customer_reviews.author: lisa dummeyer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!!
customer_reviews.text: After about a month of my 13 year old autistic son jumping on this every day nearly half of the springs have broke. The metal hooks on the springs literally broke off. How can metal break so easily? Due to very poor quality! I'm very disappointed in this trampoline. Not to mention a couple of times the springs actually popped up and hit him on the leg and ankle when they broke resulting in a small cut and a bruise. My son weighs around 110 pounds so it's not due to him being overweight.
customer_reviews.author: Gale

customer_reviews.title: assembly
customer_reviews.text: Timely delivery. This is initial review. Pleased with packaging and condition of item. One problem I had to address is that two of the springs were not attached. Fortunately I was able to enlist the help of a knowledgeable friend who devised a method to reattach the springs. It is not a simple operation due to the strength of the springs. Will write another review after using product for a period of time.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: First thing in the morning after a glass of water, 5-10 minutes, a real wakeup
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Several springs became seperated. material loops that they are connected to gave out.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my two-year-old nephew as a Christmas present, after searching the internet for kid's trampolines and only finding them for $100 or more. He loves the big trampoline, but of course, has to have an adult on it with him. I was a little nervous about ordering this, since it's not really intended for children, so when I got it I put it together and let my six-year-old try it out. It is very low to the ground, which is definitely a plus. She was able to bounce on it without any problems. I can't wait to give this to my nephew!
customer_reviews.author: jvossler85

customer_reviews.title: Springs Break Easily
customer_reviews.text: We have had this exactly 1 year and have 3 broken springs. Only the granddaughter uses it and she only weighs 47 Lbs. which is less than one fifth the max weight of 250 Lbs. That's pretty flimsy. And to replace the springs, with the cheapest shipping they want $28 !
customer_reviews.author: John  Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: great fun and exercise.
customer_reviews.text: My son played on my sister's exercise trampoline and decided he wanted one for Christmas. This one was an excellent price. It arrived quickly in it's orginal box. The only assembly is taking caps off the threadson the trampoline and screwing the legs over those threads. After he bounced for a while, I tried it. It feels great. I really enjoyed jumping on it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy S. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: There are ups and downs
customer_reviews.text: It's bigger than I thought it would be, but that's my own fault for not visualizing the measurement before ordering. It's a wee bit squeaky to hop on, but that's my only annoyance. It's a little trampoline. I jump on it. It bounces me back up. It doesn't give me foot rubs or sing me songs, but I'm okay with that.
customer_reviews.author: Anneli Kunze

customer_reviews.title: One of the legs on the product was not threaded ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the legs on the product was not threaded, so it couldn't be screwed on, making the entire product not usable. No clear directions on how to get a replacement leg. Any help would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie N Eaton

customer_reviews.title: High quality. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in very short time. Very easy to assembled, as witnessed by my 12 year old grandson with no tools. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Snyder

product_meta.title: Pure Fun Mini Rebounder Trampoline, Ages 13+
product_meta.description:
The Pure Fun 38-inch Exercise Trampoline is the perfect solution for a low impact cardio workout. Rebound training has been proven to increase bone density, detoxify the lymphatic system, increase balance and coordination, as well as strengthen and tone the body's core muscles. Each trampoline contains 32 high-tension springs, making it sturdy and durable. The superior construction ensures you get a good cardiovascular workout, regardless of how much space you have available. Mini rebounder trampolines are great for progressive exercise routines because they are gentle on the joints. With a number of routines available, you will never get bored and will stay motivated to achieve your fitness goals.

AMAZON.COM
Add a little fun to your workout routine with the Pure Fun 38-inch mini trampoline. The trampoline is built to last, with hardened steel legs, a high-quality polypropylene jumping surface that supports up to 220 pounds, and a padded skirt that covers the 32 heavy-duty steel springs. Not only is it a great way to increase your cardio fitness and lose weight, but it also gives your kids a fun way to burn energy on rainy days. The mini trampoline measures 38 inches in diameter by 8.5 inches tall and weighs 15.2 pounds. The legs screw off for easy storage.
feature_bullets: 38-inch jumping surface provides plenty of space to safely bounce
32 sturdy 2.75-inch galvanized steel springs for superior bouncing
Exterior trampoline pad is cushioned to avoid injuries when bouncing
Jump mat made of heavy-duty polypropylene to ensure durability

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
